casebody.data:
George L. SHELDON and Nelson E. Taylor, on Behalf of Themselves and All Others Similarly Situated, Appellants, v. Carroll REECE and Ezra R. Whitla, on Behalf of Themselves and All Others Similarly Situated, and Perry W. Howard and Lee M. Owen, on Behalf of Themselves and All Others Similarly Situated. No. 9759. United States Court of Appeals Third Circuit. Submitted March 25, 1949. Decided March 30, 1949. W. Woolston, of Philadelphia, Pa., and Alfred Stoner, of Greenwood, Miss., for appellants. Raymond Pace Alexander, of Philadelphia, Pa., for appellees.

Before MARIS, O’CONNELL, and KALODNER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

It being clear that the controversy involved in this case is moot, the appeal will be dismissed.
